remarks: There is at most one line through any two distinct points.  Hilbert's axiom I.2 for geometry.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 25-May-2019.)
statement:
tglineelsb2.p $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
tglineelsb2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tglineelsb2.1 $e |- ( ph -> P e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. B ) $.
tglineelsb2.4 $e |- ( ph -> P =/= Q ) $.
tghilberti2 $p |- ( ph -> E* x e. ran L ( P e. x /\ Q e. x ) ) $.
$d B x $.
$d G x $.
$d I x $.
$d L x $.
$d P x $.
$d Q x $.
$d ph x $.
